captions.text:
-Lively Lateef Brock of Clinton,
Maryland is eight years old.

He'd rather show you than tell
you all that he could do now.

Throwing a football, like the
Redskins' Robert Griffin, III.

Why is it good to
hold it that way,

so you've got like a
little of the laces on you?

-Because my hand-- look
how I throw like this.
And look how I throw like this.

-People who see him
even today would never

know that he's been
through so much.

In all sense of the
word, he's a miracle.

-At birth, Lateef was diagnosed
with end-stage renal disease.

His kidneys were functioning
at less than 20%,

when Claris and Howard
became his foster parents.

He's a very, very
strong little boy.

Through all that
he's been through,

He hasn't refused to
take the medicines that

If you think of it, he's been
fighting all his life to live.
to live beyond his first year.

Lateef would undergo
several grueling surgeries

on his kidneys
and urinary tract.

-When I look Lateef
and see everything

that he's gone through,
it makes me stronger.

Just how strong he is,
because he's a strong kid.

-Last year, it was
finally time for Lateef

What was that like
to go through?

-Hard, painful, and
all that other stuff.

-Having a new kidney
changed Lateef's life,

So, it was then that we began to
introduce him to flag football.

-Lateef would love
to test his skills

-What do you think it'll
be like to meet RG3?

-What made meeting RG3 the
thing you wanted to do?

-Lateef isn't expecting this
phone call, with Redskins coach

Mike Shanahan on
the line for him.

-This is Mike Shanahan with
the Washington Redskins.

-Hey, I've been watching
some film on you.

We've got a mini camp
coming up, and we'd
like you to be part of it.
-Can you show up and help us?

-OK, Lateef, tell your
parents I said hello,

get a cheerleaders welcome,
as they arrive by limo

at the Redskins training
facility in Ashburn, Virginia.

Inside, GM Bruce Allen
signs Lateef to a contract.

-This means you're going to
be a Washington Redskin, OK?

You can actually take
two, because you're

-As the Redskins do a signing,
Lateef is invited to speak.

-Would you like to
say a few words?

-It's off to the
locker room where

Lateef is amazed to
find his own locker.

Meanwhile, someone is sneaking
in, just to meet Lateef.
It's your hat right there, baby.

-And seconds later, just
like old teammates--

---they're racing, and chatting
on their way to the practice

-My mom has a cast
just like you.

-Now, the child who
spent his first seven

years in a medical nightmare
is playing catch with RG3.
He likes what he sees a lot.
-You got a little arm on, man.

You might need to
play quarterback.
You want it to go deep?
Let me see your touchdown dance.

-Lateef and RG3 ace
their agility drill.

Then wrap it up with a race
before the horn sounds--

Lateef throws some passes with
Redskins legend Joe Theismann.

-Robert's been working
with you, hasn't he?

-Then gets called onto
the field by the coach.

-And the offensive mastermind
has the play for Lateef to run.

-We're going to run
the sweep, and we're

going to see if you can
take it in the end zone, OK?

Run it all the way to
end zone, man, all right?
I'll meet you in the end zone.

And it's a pitch
to Lateef Brock.

And he's got an
open field ahead--

-Redskins miss left and
right, as Lateef scores.

-RG3 congratulates his new
friend in the end zone.

-Lateef's hungry for more
after a sensational wish, that

saw him ready to take on
anyone, and run full out
